meanings.definition: To revoke or annul a law or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to repeal the outdated law.
meanings.sent2: They voted to repeal the new tax regulation.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if they tried to repeal the law of gravity!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to repeal any worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could repeal any spell cast upon him.

meanings.definition: The act of revoking or annulling a law or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The repeal of the controversial law caused a stir in the community.
meanings.sent2: She studied the history of the repeal of certain policies.
meanings.sent3: The repeal of the rule led to chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The repeal of the law was like a breath of fresh air for the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The repeal of the ban on pets in the park brought joy to many families.
